sub_title:
CE and Global Director: Intelligent Automation at SmartTechNXT
Director: Afrinique Foundation for Women and Youth in STEM
summary:
Value Engineer | Business Integration Specialist | Business Architecture Transformation Specialist | Value Chain 4IR Optimisation Specialist

Profile:
Laureen is Global Director: Intelligent Automation at SmartTech NXT. She is passionate about helping businesses with end-to-end transformation for sustainable growth through innovation and digitalization. Laureen is the chief solution architect for RPA technologies in the intelligent automation practice responsible for leading large scale digital transformation programs. She is also the lead advisor to Digital Transformation and IA Centre of Excellence directors. She has held several technical leadership roles in end-to-end supply over her 25-year career in Engineering & Manufacturing. Prior to her current role, she was Director: Synergies & Integration as well as Transformation Director: Network of Capabilities Centers at Anheuser-Busch InBev where she led the Digital Transformation across 14 markets. She holds the following qualifications: a BSc in Chemical Engineering and an MSc in Engineering from the University of Cape Town; a Master of Business Leadership from UNISA’s Graduate School of Business Leadership; and a PhD in Organizational Behavior from the University of Pretoria. Laureen is a Six Sigma Black Belt and Master Black Belt and holds a Certificate of Competence in Lean Manufacturing from Wits University. Laureen believes in life-long learning and in coaching and mentoring others. She is also an IA academy trainer and Future of Work coach. This enables her to stay at the cutting edge of new ways to harness the power of people and technology to make organizations work better.

Laureen also believes deeply in the power of community development through social innovation. She served on the SAB Foundation board of trustees as member of the investment committee and as a judge for the annual Social Innovation and Disability Empowerment Awards. She is a founder and Director of Afrinique Foundation, dedicated to making STEM education and careers in STEM accessible to economically marginalized youth and women in Africa. Laureen is a published author and a speaker at local and international conferences.

school.name: SAB Cyril Ramaphosa World of Learning
SAB Cyril Ramaphosa World of Learning
Unisa Graduate School of Business Leadership (SBL)

profile_positions.description:
Organizations that choose simpler, smarter automation are better equipped to thrive in a highly digitized and fast-moving world. Our mission is to create simplified, people-centric ways to digitally transform businesses. At SmartTechNXT we automate business processes with smart technology in the service of people to unlock business value.
Dr Laureen van Aswegen has over 25 years combined experience in executive technical leadership and business process transformation. The focus of her roles as both Global Director: Intelligent Automation and member of the joint Chief Executive Committee for SmartTechNXT is to grow the capability of the company’s Robotic Process Automation delivery engine and spearhead the development of new innovative product lines at the cutting edge of Blockchain and Edge Device technologies.
Laureen leads the Intelligent Automation and New Product Development teams in Southern Africa and Europe, delivering solutions to clients in EMEA and the USA.
The World Trade Center Twente’s ‘Women in International Business’ initiative recognized that Laureen’s “unwavering commitment to delivering excellent value to customers through Intelligent Automation Solutions is an inspiration to women entrepreneurs who are looking to expand their ventures internationally”. 
Laureen is also co-founder of the SANEC Smart Tech Desk, a partnership with SANEC (Southern African Netherlands Chamber of Commerce) and Nuffic Neso that hosts the SA-NL Digital Internship Program. It is one of the first international tandem internship programs in the world. The internship develops talent bilaterally in The Netherlands and Southern Africa. The program was honored by His Excellency the South African Ambassador to The Netherlands: “We are pleased that we have in the Netherlands an important partner in higher education and vocational training. The collaboration between SmartTechNXT, SANEC’s members and Nuffic Neso is a model which we can proudly showcase to other countries.”
profile_positions.title: Director: Intelligent Automation

profile_positions.description: At Pétanque NXT, Laureen’s focus was on building the Group's value engineering and digital business transformation capability within EMEA and CAPAC. She led the expansion of the company into Europe and the subsequent growth and spin-off of the Intelligent Automation practice into an independent legal entity with its Head Quarters established in The Netherlands.
profile_positions.title: Global Director: Value Engineering

profile_positions.description:
•	accelerated the establishment of an offshore capability centre providing business services to various markets in Africa

•	 led the transformation of service delivery from business to both new and established global service centres

•	led the integrated programs to enable the off-shore capability centre with new data transfer capability, new transaction capability, new and enhanced systems architecture and new data processing capabilities using Robotic Process Automation (RPA) to enable transitions of services from the businesses to the capability centres
profile_positions.title: Director: Network of Capability Centres: Transformation
Director: Synergies & Integration

profile_positions.description:
Appointed Day 1 Champion for the SABMiller/ABInBev combination in Africa. My key accomplishments were:

•	Lead business advisor to the SAB Pty Ltd legal team facilitating Competition Commission approval in South Africa for the combination
•	Led the Africa business readiness program for the merger go-live (Day1) on 11 October 2016 across seven work streams including People, Finance, Commercial, Legal & Corporate Affairs, Supply Chain, Technology Solutions and Procurement
profile_positions.title: Africa Zone Day 1 Champion SABMiller/ABInBev Merger

profile_positions.description:
Led the One Africa PMO transformation capability to ensure all strategic programs could be executed in a collaborative coordinated way through one Program Management Office. All regions and divisions in SAB Ltd had traditionally operated autonomously. Through this role we integrated and centrally co-ordinated several disparate marketing campaigns, new product development projects, sales effectiveness improvement programs, operational efficiency efficiency, corporate social investment programs and information technology investment programs, while globalising SABs ways of working. Highlights:

•	cross functional programs that delivered hundreds of millions of US dollars in top line growth and operational efficiency
•	large scale poverty alleviation corporate social programs of which the flagship was the highly acclaimed Women in Maize initiative of the award winning Go Farming program
profile_positions.title: General Manager: Business Integration

profile_positions.description:
Senior Executive leadership of the FMCG manufacturing business unit which entailed:
•	day to day operational management and full responsibility for the income statement and balance sheet of the brewing business unit
•	developing the strategy and executing the turnaround of a business unit that was in decline across a range of KPIs, to meet the aggressive market growth and operational efficiency goals of the larger business.
•	winning the hearts and minds of several hundred employees in the business unit, as well as contractors, suppliers and business partners, to unite behind the executon of a pinnacle turnaround strategy backed up with the right investment
profile_positions.title: General Manager Chamdor Brewing Business

profile_positions.description: Led the deployment of lean / world class manufacturing programs for the company. In collaboration with all regional General Managers I led the development of the manufacturing strategy, designed the operational excellence improvement plans and led the implementation of World Class Manufacturng through a coordinated functionally integrated organizational approach across all manufacturing regions. The role required growing SAB’s operational excellence maturity over a five-year period through the development and delivery of learning solutions for WCM, Lean, Six Sigma and focussed improvement programs, including competence assessments,  ongoing coaching of leaders, practitioners and employees. This role allowed me to lead an internal consulting capability providing technical and transformational services to all regions and divisions. In this role I was a business partner, working collaboratively with senior leaders to transform the performance of their regions through their teams from the shop floor to their most senior leaders. In this role I was also the Manufacturing & Technical Business Process Lead for the SAP Global Template.
profile_positions.title: Manufacturing Development Manager

profile_positions.description: Managed and grew a consulting business for the deployment of World Class Manufacturing, Lean, Six Sigma and other continuous improvement methodologies of the highly acclaimed Mission Directed Workteams (MDW) program. This entailed training, competence assessments and ongoing coaching of leaders, practitioners and shop floor employees in client companies, and extensive auditing of operational excellence standards. Clients included large FMCG, manufacturing, banking  and mining businesses, as well as state-owned enterprises and government service departments.
profile_positions.title: Director

profile_positions.description: Expert consultant providing scientific solutions to problems and generating insights from data using qualitative and quantitative techniques such as content analysis, statistical process analysis, exploratory factor analysis, confirmatory factor analysis, latent variable modelling, queuing theory, process design simulations, design of experiments (DOE), theory of constraints (TOC), Lean (A3, VSM), Six Sigma (DMAIC, DMADV), I4Innovation and E2(e2e)2E.
profile_positions.title: Managing Partner

profile_positions.description: I joined The South African Breweries in 1999 as a Packaging Engineer at the then Pietersburg Brewery. Thereafter I was appointed as Brewing Engineer and Engineering Manager of the Pietersburg Brewery, then Project Manager of the Chamdor 2007 brewery expansion project and then Brewing Manager of the newly commissioned state of the art Ibhayi Brewery. Each of these roles principally required the management and development of talented individuals to achieve stretch goals for continuously improving quality, speed and cost performance of the breweries. Through these roles I learnt how to manage ever increasing numbers of employees but mostly how to lead and develop people using SABMiller’s People Way and high-performance culture methods. I also learnt how to work with my teams to improve processes and operational practices by implementing Lean, Six Sigma and World Class Manufacturing techniques.
profile_positions.title: Packaging Engineer, Brewing Engineer, Project Manager, Engineering Manager and Brewing Manager

volunteer_experiences.description: Sponsoring outreach and sponsoring school fees, uniforms and stationery for learners enabling them to have access to education. There are a vast number of children in our communities, whose family circumstances prevent them from receiving even the basics of schooling, yet they have managed to rise above these circumstances and are able to achieve excellent results at school (between 70 and 90% on average). These children are continually faced with hardship and poverty. Some of them in dire conditions and sometimes don't even have a slice of bread to fill their empty stomachs. Their lives are plagued by drugs, poverty, unemployment and single parent homes. However, these children still maintain an air of pride, achievement and hopefulness that makes our assistance worthwhile. Follow the link to make a difference. http://assistalearnertrust.com

Set up in 2010 as one element of the broad-based black economic empowerment transaction conducted by South African Breweries Ltd (SAB), the SAB Foundation is an independent trust that annually invests millions of rands towards developing entrepreneurship in South Africa and the benefit of the wider South African community.

volunteer_experiences.role: Judge - Social Innovation and Disability Empowerment Awards
volunteer_experiences.description:
I have participated as a judge in the 2016, 2017 and 2018 awards. The judging process takes place over several weeks and entails detailed assessments of social innovations submitted by entrepreneurs based on the technical merits of the innovation, its commercial feasibility and its potential to economically empower target communities. 


Dear Laureen
 
 
SAB Foundation thanks you for your time, commitment and expertise given during the 2018 Social Innovation and Disability Empowerment Awards.  
 
We appreciate your dedication in ensuring that social entrepreneurs are recognized and rewarded for their contributions to our society. 
 
Your contribution to the judging process ensures that we are able to achieve our objective of the provision of funding for small, medium and micro-sized enterprises, in order to contribute to the economic and social empowerment of historically disadvantaged persons.
